targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  ROUND(convert_km(sum(distance)::numeric, '$length_unit'), 0) || ' $length_unit' as "Logged",
  ROUND(convert_km(max(end_km)::numeric, '$length_unit'), 0) || ' $length_unit' as "Odometer"
from drives where car_id = $car_id;
SELECT COUNT(id) AS "Charges" FROM charging_processes WHERE car_id=$car_id
SELECT COUNT(id) AS "Drives" FROM drives WHERE car_id=$car_id

SELECT COUNT(id) as "NÂº Car Updates"
FROM Updates 
WHERE car_id = $car_id

select split_part(version, ' ', 1) as "Current Car Firmware" 
from updates 
where car_id = $car_id 
order by start_date desc 
limit 1

panels.description: This means you have some **Drives** or **Charges** not closed. If so, you may follow the official guide: Manually fixing data

targets.rawSql:
SELECT COUNT(id) as "Charges not closed"
FROM charging_processes 
WHERE car_id = $car_id AND end_date is null

SELECT COUNT(id) AS "Drives not closed"
FROM drives 
WHERE car_id = $car_id AND end_date is null

panels.title: Incomplete Data

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
   relname AS "Table",
   pg_relation_size(relid) as "Data",
   pg_indexes_size(relid) as "Indexes",
   pg_total_relation_size(relid) As "Total"
FROM 
   pg_catalog.pg_statio_user_tables
ORDER BY 
   pg_total_relation_size(relid) DESC;

SELECT table_name AS "Table Name", 
       (xpath('/row/cnt/text()', xml_count))[1]::text::int AS "Row Count"
FROM (
    SELECT table_name, 
           query_to_xml(format('SELECT count(*) as cnt FROM %I.%I', table_schema, table_name), false, true, '') AS xml_count
    FROM information_schema.tables
    WHERE table_schema NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema') and table_type = 'BASE TABLE'
) AS t
ORDER BY 2 DESC;

panels.description: These statistics can help you evaluate the efficiency of your indexes. If your database experiences a lot of updates or deletions, like importing data from other sources or deleting a loaner car or some other similar situation, you might encounter index bloat, which can degrade performance. In such cases, reindexing could be beneficial. Check Reindex Database

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    relname AS "Table",
    indexrelname AS "Index",
    idx_scan AS "Index Scans",
    idx_tup_read AS "Tuples Read",
    idx_tup_fetch AS "Tuples Fetched",
    PG_RELATION_SIZE(indexrelid) as "Index Size"
FROM
    pg_stat_all_indexes
WHERE
    schemaname NOT LIKE 'pg_%' AND
    indexrelname IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 3 DESC;

options.content: Check the [contribution docs](https://docs.teslamate.org/docs/development#enable-pg_stat_statements-to-collect-query-statistics) on how to enable tracking planning and execution statistics of all SQL statements executed by a server.

panels.title: About pg_stat_statements (track statistics of SQL planning and execution)
Top 20 Statements (by mean time spent executing the statement)
Top 20 Statements (by total time spent executing the statement)

list.definition:
SELECT
    id as __value,
    CASE WHEN COUNT(id) OVER (PARTITION BY name) > 1 AND name IS NOT NULL THEN CONCAT(name, ' - ', RIGHT(vin, 6)) ELSE COALESCE(name, CONCAT('VIN ', vin)) end as __text 
FROM cars
ORDER BY display_priority ASC, name ASC, vin ASC;
list.label: Car
list.name: car_id
list.query:
SELECT
    id as __value,
    CASE WHEN COUNT(id) OVER (PARTITION BY name) > 1 AND name IS NOT NULL THEN CONCAT(name, ' - ', RIGHT(vin, 6)) ELSE COALESCE(name, CONCAT('VIN ', vin)) end as __text 
FROM cars
ORDER BY display_priority ASC, name ASC, vin ASC;

list.definition:
SELECT
    CASE WHEN $pg_stat_statements_enabled = 1 THEN 'SELECT stats_reset FROM pg_stat_statements_info;' else 'SELECT NULL;' end
list.name: pg_stat_statements_info_last_reset
list.query:
SELECT
    CASE WHEN $pg_stat_statements_enabled = 1 THEN 'SELECT stats_reset FROM pg_stat_statements_info;' else 'SELECT NULL;' end

list.definition:
SELECT
    CASE WHEN $pg_stat_statements_enabled = 1 THEN 'SELECT count(*) FROM pg_stat_statements;' else 'SELECT NULL;' end
list.name: pg_stat_statements_count
list.query:
SELECT
    CASE WHEN $pg_stat_statements_enabled = 1 THEN 'SELECT count(*) FROM pg_stat_statements;' else 'SELECT NULL;' end

list.definition:
SELECT
    CASE WHEN $pg_stat_statements_enabled = 1 THEN 'select
  calls as "Calls",
  mean_exec_time as "Mean Exec Time",
  total_exec_time as "Total Exec Time",
  query as "Query"
from pg_stat_statements
ORDER BY mean_exec_time desc
limit 20;' else 'SELECT NULL;' end
list.name: pg_stat_statements_top_20_mean
list.query:
SELECT
    CASE WHEN $pg_stat_statements_enabled = 1 THEN 'select
  calls as "Calls",
  mean_exec_time as "Mean Exec Time",
  total_exec_time as "Total Exec Time",
  query as "Query"
from pg_stat_statements
ORDER BY mean_exec_time desc
limit 20;' else 'SELECT NULL;' end

list.definition:
SELECT
    CASE WHEN $pg_stat_statements_enabled = 1 THEN 'select
  calls as "Calls",
  mean_exec_time as "Mean Exec Time",
  total_exec_time as "Total Exec Time",
  query as "Query"
from pg_stat_statements
ORDER BY total_exec_time desc
limit 20;' else 'SELECT NULL;' end
list.name: pg_stat_statements_top_20_total
list.query:
SELECT
    CASE WHEN $pg_stat_statements_enabled = 1 THEN 'select
  calls as "Calls",
  mean_exec_time as "Mean Exec Time",
  total_exec_time as "Total Exec Time",
  query as "Query"
from pg_stat_statements
ORDER BY total_exec_time desc
limit 20;' else 'SELECT NULL;' end

list.definition:
SELECT EXISTS (
SELECT 1
FROM information_schema.tables
WHERE table_name = 'pg_stat_statements'
)::int AS table_existence
list.name: pg_stat_statements_enabled
list.query:
SELECT EXISTS (
SELECT 1
FROM information_schema.tables
WHERE table_name = 'pg_stat_statements'
)::int AS table_existence
